data.title: The best donuts I've ever had...
data.text: This place is so wonderful. It's a little tricky to find if you're not familiar with the area, but it is worth the trip from no matter what part of the metro you're from. The chocolate twists are my favorite, but they truly have something for every donut lover.

data.title: Great donuts, great service
data.text: The donuts here are outstanding. The best in Kansas City from my experience. They are always fresh. Beware that they sometimes run out of some of the more popular kinds (because they don't build up a big inventory that may sit there for hours), so get there early if you can. But all of the donuts we have tried there are really good. You can eat there at the counter. The grandkids love to do that. The service is fast and accommodating.

data.title: 30 years of going is now stopping
data.text: The place used to be "the best" but our last two experiences have shown a lack of quality and caring. We have found the donuts are dryer, they gave up our favorite Carmel Long johns and they have not been friendly to day before orders. Special requests very early were not honored. Too bad for all!!

data.title: Great donuts!
data.text: Always fresh - fantastic staff that is super friendly.  Our favorite breakfast treat for our team. Support your local KC businesses :)

data.title: As good as advertised
data.text:
This place has amazing donuts and deserves its high ranking. A lot of great donuts, but let me help you out. Try these three and thank me later :)

1. Apple Fritter
2. Carmel
3. Glazed

data.title: Best doughnuts around
data.text:
Go for the fritter, get there early!  Owner makes a limited amount every day and the place is usually closed by 10am at the latest.
Walking in it feels like the place hasn't changed in 50 years, which it probably has not.  Someone is always behind the crescent shaped counter to help you.  Grab a coffee with your doughnut and enjoy the time warp.

data.title: Old School Donuts
data.text:
I've been going to John's Donuts since 1976 when my 4 month old daughter was making too much noise early Saturday mornings. I would put her in her car seat and simply get her out of the apartment. Most often than not we would end up at the nearby John's Space Age donut shop. We continued this routine until she was well into her teens. Now she is a mother with two children of her own. When they spend the night at our house, In the morning they ALWAYS ask me if I will take them to John's for donuts.
My Grandson orders the long johns, my Granddaughter orders the cake "sprinkle" donuts and I like the apple fritters - chocolate milk all around.  This Downtown Overland Park landmark has been around since 1971 and, as you can guess, has a rabid following. Some of the folks behind the counter have been working there for decades. The vibe is retro with a sweeping counter and swivel stools. In this modern world of pre-fab, assembly line pastries cranked out by national donut store chains, this place is a refreshing departure........a place that deserves to be patronized for as long as possible.
They don't promote and give away product for free like some of the chains, but their pastries are larger and cost less. The day will come soon enough when your choices will only be the big chains.

data.title: HOLY OF HOLIES donuts
data.text: I love me a good donut and this is the spot!! It is an old fashioned donut space.  It has a long l shaped counter with the swinging counter chairs ala the 1960's.  The glazed are the stuff of legends.  Simply delicious.  I also had a coconut iced cake donut.  It was an 8 out of 10.  But the glazed still held my heart with an outstanding 12 out of 10.  Worth every cellulite laden calorie.  My 13 year old son stated they were amazing!  And I agree.  I am so glad I don't live near here.  Thank you for the memories.

data.title: Best Donuts in Kansas City
data.text: The best glazed donuts in Kansas City. Hands down. They have limited hours, but so worth it. Family owned, lovely people, and such good donuts!

data.title: Awesome Donuts from Space!
data.text: I am visiting from Boston and heard about John's Space Age Donuts. I love local food over national chains. John's donuts are fresh and very tasty at a great price. Staff was wonderful. I only wish my stomach had "space" for more donuts...

data.title: Really good donuts
data.text: John's Space Age Donuts are amazing. The frosted cake donuts are my favorite. They are fresh and delicious. They run out fast, especially on Sundays, so you need to get up early to get the best variety.

data.title: Holy cow hot glazed !
data.text: Heard about the place never been there went this morning and when I walked in very friendly staff asked me if I wanted a fresh hot glazed donut right out of the fryer I agreed to try the doughnut it was the best glazed doughnut I have ever had in my life hands-down delicious

data.title: yummy yummy yummy
data.text: I have been going to this place since the 80s, skipping 2nd period and getting doughnuts.  I happen to live near by now and it is a favorite on the weekends.  the applefritters are second to none!  in fact, there is not a doughnut there not worth  their calories.  love this place

data.title: Most wonderful donut's at Johns
data.text: I love this place.    Very old-school with bakers in white pants and shirt making  small batches of very tasty donuts.   I have never been disappointed in the quality of anything I've had here and want to comment that my experience with their service has always been good.   Everything is good but I am a sucker for yeast donuts and also like their cinnamon twists.    If you're in the mood for donuts, skip Lamar's and Krispy Kreme and get over to John's!

data.title: 20 years ago this was good - Last 10 years Terrible
data.text: No one under the age of 40 will tell you this has good donuts because they can't remember them ever being good.  It was years ago - LOUSY now.  Service is awful, run by a bunch of grouchy people.  Yuk!  Like one reviewer said - go to Lamar's - YES it is good and the people are great there.

data.title: Best Donuts in K.C. Area, but poor service
data.text: Having been rudely awakened @ 03:00 hours by some inebriated females at my Overland Park hotel, I decided to find out what the internet considered to be "The Best Donuts in Kansas City".  I found John's Space Age Donuts.  These are definitely the best quality and best tasting donuts I have ever eaten (homemade not included).  However, I have not lived to be 49 and not appreciate good service as well.  In these hard times, a friendly smile and a few kind words go a long way, and in "MY" opinion, make the food taste even better.  This place must have been VERY proud of their wares, as they could care less about the people buying them. Here is my experience:  I arrived at the front door @ 05:58 hours (on the nose).  At exactly 06:00 hours, a stern looking lady slowly walked over and turned on every sign, light, etc. and then... unlocked the front door without opening it, only to walk away as if I had not been standing there, dying to see what all that great smelling air was about (insert sigh here).  Two minutes later she decided to wait on me at the front counter.  Then, when I asked for "hot" donuts, she explained sarcastically, that there were none, and became very frustrated when I became puzzled about a famous donut shop NOT HAVING HOT DONUTS FOR THEIR FIRST CUSTOMER!!!  Well, since my soft-hearted wife was there, I decided to buy a dozen mixed donuts anyway.  Then, we drove to "Lamar's" donut shop over on College, where they greeted us with open arms... and yes, TERRIFIC HOT DONUTS!!  So, the moral of the story is this... Go to Lamar's!!  Any Questions?  :)

data.title: Best doughnuts in KC
data.text: I have been going to John's for more than 30 and have never had a better doughnut. in particular, the caramel cinnamon rolls  spectacular!
